source.author: Jeanes, J.A.
source.title: Asteraceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae
source.citation: From: Jeanes, J.A. (1999). Asteraceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Stem less than 1 cm diam. at base; leaves mostly cauline, herbaceous, green, shallowly pinnatifid to toothed; cypselas smooth to sparsely scabrous on margins and ribs; plant a slender annual to 80 cm high

Stem 1–2 cm diam. at base; leaves basally rosetted and cauline, coriaceous, often glaucous, pinnatifid to pinnatisect; cypselas scabrous on margins and ribs; plant a robust annual or biennial to 150 cm high
